Turns a crosstable object into a flextable

Source: R/flextable.R
as_flextable.Rd

These objects are imported from other packages. Follow the links below to see their documentation.

flextable

as_flextable

# S3 method for crosstable
as_flextable(
  x,
  autofit = TRUE,
  compact = FALSE,
  show_test_name = TRUE,
  by_header = NULL,
  keep_id = FALSE,
  generic_labels = list(id = ".id", variable = "variable", value = "value", total =
    "Total", label = "label", test = "test", effect = "effect"),
  ...
)

Arguments

x

the result of crosstable()
autofit

whether to use flextable::autofit on the table
compact

whether to compact the table
show_test_name

in the test column, show the test name
by_header

a string to override the by header
keep_id

whether to keep the .id column
generic_labels

names of the crosstable default columns
...

unused

Methods (by class)

  • crosstable: Turns a crosstable object into a formatted flextable.
    You can also use the alias cross_to_flextable or its shortcut ctf() which has the same arguments.

See also

crosstable(), flextable::flextable()

Examples

#Crosstables
library(crosstable)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
crosstable(mtcars2) %>% as_flextable()
#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `label`, `variable`, `value` 
#> header has 1 row(s) 
#> body has 46 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#>   .id               label   variable            value
#> 1 mpg   Miles/(US) gallon  Min / Max      10.4 / 33.9
#> 2 mpg   Miles/(US) gallon  Med [IQR] 19.2 [15.4;22.8]
#> 3 mpg   Miles/(US) gallon Mean (std)       20.1 (6.0)
#> 4 mpg   Miles/(US) gallon     N (NA)           32 (0)
#> 5 cyl Number of cylinders          4      11 (34.38%)
crosstable(mtcars2, by=vs, test = TRUE) %>% as_flextable()
#> Warning: Be aware that automatic global testing should only be done in an exploratory context, as it would cause extensive alpha inflation otherwise.
#> This message is displayed once per session.
#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `label`, `variable`, `straight`, `vshaped`, `test` 
#> header has 2 row(s) 
#> body has 44 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#>   .id               label   variable         straight          vshaped
#> 1 mpg   Miles/(US) gallon  Min / Max      17.8 / 33.9      10.4 / 26.0
#> 2 mpg   Miles/(US) gallon  Med [IQR] 22.8 [21.4;29.6] 15.6 [14.8;19.1]
#> 3 mpg   Miles/(US) gallon Mean (std)       24.6 (5.4)       16.6 (3.9)
#> 4 mpg   Miles/(US) gallon     N (NA)           14 (0)           18 (0)
#> 5 cyl Number of cylinders          4      10 (90.91%)        1 (9.09%)
#>                                                      test
#> 1                  p value: <0.0001 \n(Two Sample t-test)
#> 2                  p value: <0.0001 \n(Two Sample t-test)
#> 3                  p value: <0.0001 \n(Two Sample t-test)
#> 4                  p value: <0.0001 \n(Two Sample t-test)
#> 5 p value: <0.0001 \n(Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data)
crosstable(esoph, by=tobgp, test = TRUE) %>% as_flextable()
#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `label`, `variable`, `0-9g/day`, `10-19`, `20-29`, `30+`, `test` 
#> header has 2 row(s) 
#> body has 18 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#>     .id label variable   0-9g/day      10-19      20-29        30+
#> 1 agegp agegp    25-34 4 (26.67%) 4 (26.67%) 3 (20.00%) 4 (26.67%)
#> 2 agegp agegp    35-44 4 (26.67%) 4 (26.67%) 4 (26.67%) 3 (20.00%)
#> 3 agegp agegp    45-54 4 (25.00%) 4 (25.00%) 4 (25.00%) 4 (25.00%)
#> 4 agegp agegp    55-64 4 (25.00%) 4 (25.00%) 4 (25.00%) 4 (25.00%)
#> 5 agegp agegp    65-74 4 (26.67%) 4 (26.67%) 4 (26.67%) 3 (20.00%)
#>                                                     test
#> 1 p value: 0.9999 \n(Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data)
#> 2 p value: 0.9999 \n(Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data)
#> 3 p value: 0.9999 \n(Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data)
#> 4 p value: 0.9999 \n(Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data)
#> 5 p value: 0.9999 \n(Fisher's Exact Test for Count Data)
crosstable(iris, by=Species, test = TRUE) %>% as_flextable(autofit=FALSE)
#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `label`, `variable`, `setosa`, `versicolor`, `virginica`, `test` 
#> header has 2 row(s) 
#> body has 16 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#>            .id        label   variable        setosa    versicolor
#> 1 Sepal.Length Sepal.Length  Min / Max     4.3 / 5.8     4.9 / 7.0
#> 2 Sepal.Length Sepal.Length  Med [IQR] 5.0 [4.8;5.2] 5.9 [5.6;6.3]
#> 3 Sepal.Length Sepal.Length Mean (std)     5.0 (0.4)     5.9 (0.5)
#> 4 Sepal.Length Sepal.Length     N (NA)        50 (0)        50 (0)
#> 5  Sepal.Width  Sepal.Width  Min / Max     2.3 / 4.4     2.0 / 3.4
#>       virginica
#> 1     4.9 / 7.9
#> 2 6.5 [6.2;6.9]
#> 3     6.6 (0.6)
#> 4        50 (0)
#> 5     2.2 / 3.8
#>                                                                            test
#> 1 p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances))
#> 2 p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances))
#> 3 p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances))
#> 4 p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances))
#> 5                                p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means)
crosstable(iris, by=Species, test = TRUE) %>% as_flextable(compact=TRUE)
#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `variable`, `setosa`, `versicolor`, `virginica`, `test` 
#> header has 2 row(s) 
#> body has 20 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#>       variable        setosa    versicolor     virginica
#> 1 Sepal.Length                                          
#> 2    Min / Max     4.3 / 5.8     4.9 / 7.0     4.9 / 7.9
#> 3    Med [IQR] 5.0 [4.8;5.2] 5.9 [5.6;6.3] 6.5 [6.2;6.9]
#> 4   Mean (std)     5.0 (0.4)     5.9 (0.5)     6.6 (0.6)
#> 5       N (NA)        50 (0)        50 (0)        50 (0)
#>                                                                            test
#> 1 p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances))
#> 2                                                                              
#> 3                                                                              
#> 4                                                                              
#> 5                                                                              
crosstable(iris) %>% as_flextable(compact=TRUE, autofit=TRUE)
#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `variable`, `value` 
#> header has 1 row(s) 
#> body has 24 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#>       variable         value
#> 1 Sepal.Length              
#> 2    Min / Max     4.3 / 7.9
#> 3    Med [IQR] 5.8 [5.1;6.4]
#> 4   Mean (std)     5.8 (0.8)
#> 5       N (NA)       150 (0)

#Renaming
crosstable(iris, by=Species, total="both", test=TRUE, effect=TRUE) %>%
   rename(ID=.id, math=variable, Tot=Total, lab=label, pval=test, fx=effect) %>%
   as_flextable(by_header = "The specie",
                      generic_labels=list(id = "ID", variable = "math", total="Tot",
                                          label = "lab", test = "pval", effect="fx"))
#> Warning: Could not calculate crosstable effects for variables 'Sepal.Length', 'Sepal.Width', 'Petal.Length' and 'Petal.Width'. Aren't there 2 groups exactly?
#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `lab`, `math`, `setosa`, `versicolor`, `virginica`, `Tot`, `fx`, `pval` 
#> header has 2 row(s) 
#> body has 16 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#>             ID          lab       math        setosa    versicolor
#> 1 Sepal.Length Sepal.Length  Min / Max     4.3 / 5.8     4.9 / 7.0
#> 2 Sepal.Length Sepal.Length  Med [IQR] 5.0 [4.8;5.2] 5.9 [5.6;6.3]
#> 3 Sepal.Length Sepal.Length Mean (std)     5.0 (0.4)     5.9 (0.5)
#> 4 Sepal.Length Sepal.Length     N (NA)        50 (0)        50 (0)
#> 5  Sepal.Width  Sepal.Width  Min / Max     2.3 / 4.4     2.0 / 3.4
#>       virginica           Tot         fx
#> 1     4.9 / 7.9     4.3 / 7.9 No effect?
#> 2 6.5 [6.2;6.9] 5.8 [5.1;6.4] No effect?
#> 3     6.6 (0.6)     5.8 (0.8) No effect?
#> 4        50 (0)       150 (0) No effect?
#> 5     2.2 / 3.8     2.0 / 4.4 No effect?
#>                                                                            pval
#> 1 p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances))
#> 2 p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances))
#> 3 p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances))
#> 4 p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances))
#> 5                                p value: <0.0001 \n(One-way analysis of means)
